snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said Israel and the Palestinian Authority had agreed to join him in Washington in hopes of resuming formal talks for the first time since 2010.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry announces that Israeli and Palestinian leaders have established a basis to resume direct peace negotiations for the first time in three years; announcement comes after an intense round of shuttle diplomacy aimed at reviving the dormant Middle East peace process.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Amman, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said Israel and the Palestinian Authority had agreed to join him in Washington in hopes of resuming formal talks for the first time since 2010.

headline.main: Kerry Achieves Deal to Revive Mideast Talks
headline.print_headline: Kerry Achieves Deal to Revive Mideast Talks
